#text=Yesterday while I was riding my bike I got a flat tire .
#text=Luckily I had a tire repair kit in the garage .
#text=The first thing I did was use a flathead screwdriver to pop the tire off of the rim .
#text=The tire is hollow inside , with no tube .
#text=The patch kit contains small rubber patches with glue , that you use to seal up any holes that might appear .
#text=When I had the tire off the rim I looked all around inside to find the hole .
#text=When I found it , I used a special piece of sandpaper inside the repair kit to clean off the area around the hole , so the glue would stick nicely .
#text=I then applied the glue and put one of the small rubber patches onto it .
#text=The instructions said to let it dry for a few hours , so I went inside and watched TV .
#text=After awhile I came back out and put the tire back on the rim , then used a pump to pump the tire full of air .
